title: Should i buy runes at level 17. But i mostly play with my friend  who is level 30and other level 30.
body: I Play with my friend 90% of the time. Who is level 30. And other ppl who are above 20. Should I but runes. Because I'm playing ppl who have runes. To keep up. My stats

replies.body: Ignore the Rioter who responded. Don't buy them. In 3 levels you unlock access to the best tier runes in the game. So if you are going to fill out a Rune Page, save them up until you hit 20.
Tier one runes are 5 IP per rune and 15 for quints. Oh no, I wasted one first win of the day in the long term!

> [{quoted}](name=R110,realm=EUW,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=KHK0wAbl,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-08-18T08:10:31.677+0000)
>
> Tier one runes are 5 IP per rune and 15 for quints. Oh no, I wasted one first win of the day in the long term!

Just because they are cheap doesn't mean they aren't bad.

Tier one runes don't really put a dent in your amount of IP. The stats they give aren't too shabby either.

Seal of Armor
Tier 1: 0,56 armor
Tier 3: 1 armor

56% effiency for (almost) free is not bad for a new player. 

They are basically free replacements while you go through the tedious work of grinding 205/410IP for 1 tier 3 rune. Not to mention 2k IP quints.

I wouldn't buy Tier 1 runes anymore.

You'll have to keep turning off the Tier 1 checkbox so they don't block your real runes later on.  You can't get rid of them ever.

Tier 1 Runes = Riot Herpes
Yeah. Just wait until 3 more levels. Then use all the IP you have saved up for some tier 3 runes.

Don't ever spend your ip on Runes that are lower than tier 3. I hate the rune system and everything about it is a needless ip grind but you need the tier 3 to be on even footing with everybody else once you start ranked.
no, just wait till you can get tier 3 runes.

I'd recommend buying tier 1 runes for the slots you've currently got. A single first win of the day game will pretty much let you fill out a rune page and in the long run the extra stats should pay for themselves in IP. Once you hit 20 of course you can then start grabbing Tier 3 runes which are what you'll want long term.
Why is this rune system still in place, anyway?

Are you talking about the rune system itself, or the tiers?

The tiers, at least right now, are so you spend most of your IP pre-20 buying champions because you'll need at least 16 for ranked play. Tier 3 runes cost a whole lot more, but are needed for a competitive level, and are so kept locked until level 20 so you can focus on learning the game, earning some champions to learn, and all that instead of buying expensive runes that will make games a bit too easy early stat-wise when you should be focusing on basic mechanics. And to prevent noob traps, because we've all been there >.> (scaling AD quints OP on adc, yes I made that mistake).

The rune system itself. Irredeemably expensive, riddled with trap options, lacking in actual satisfaction (especially long-term), and sporadically problematic for balance. It's an incredibly bad system, with only two good aspects: 1. Customization options (not nearly as robust as Masteries), 2. RP generation (IP boosts to be able to actually afford the breadth of runes/champs/rune pages needed to play competetively).

>Irredeemably expensive,

Oh god I wish they would make tier 3 runes just a little cheaper... or boost IP gains. Yay, I can get .83% cooldown reduction for the price of 8-16 games (not counting first win of the day).

The rune system is the main reason why I play other MOBAs in place of league some times. I know they were made for an IP sink, but champions are already there for that. It's not like DOTA in which heroes are free, so you'd need to spend them on something else. I get people just stack tons of IP because they have all the champions, but when you get to that point, you usually already have all the runes you need.
The rune system is the only thing I'll agree with getting rid of.

Excuse me, but is there any plan to reform the current rune system, it seems like a very slow and painful process of collection, and I feel as though this can be a barrier when trying to get started, or get serious with LoL, especially with the IP costs for rune pages/T3 runes.  

To get them  "you need to play 210.2 Days (24/7), 12611.9 Hours, 302688 Minutes OR 7147 Games."

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/213goj/how_long_does_it_take_to_buy_all_runes_with_ip

^Source^

I would appreciate any response.

Tier 1 rules? You mean those useless things that are a waste of Ip? Tackler. Dont listen to this guy, it seems he hasnever played LOL before in his life. Wait and buy tier 3 runes.

Or dont buy them at all because riot doesnt want "players to grind".
Oh how, oh how on Earth would anyone ever make up the 45 IP from getting the armor seals?!    What a terrible tragedy if someone were to buy them...

Wait to buy runes until you are able to buy tier 3 runes.

As the runes are right now buying tier 1 and 2 are a waste of IP since they are quite expensive and there is no way to sell them or trade them for tier 3, plus the benefit is minimal. Wait for tier 3

> [{quoted}](name=RogueWill,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=KHK0wAbl,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-08-18T06:14:59.779+0000)
> 
> tier 1 and 2 are a waste of IP since they are quite expensive

15 IP for tier 1 quints, 5 for everything else. 100 IP for tier 2 quints, 35 for everything else. You can easily fill all available rune slots at level 17 with tier 2 runes for less than 700 IP.
700 ip is around 5-10 games you know..

700 IP is going to set you back by one tier 3 rune. This price is nothing compared to the 15-25k needed to fill a rune page with tier 3 runes.

Since rune slots are unlocked at each summoner level, those 5-10 games are all of a sudden spread throughout the course of 50-100 games.

Don't ever waste IP on anything but Tier 3 runes. Everything else is worthless and furthermore clutters your rune pages later on.

Tier 1 and 2 are pretty much just noob traps. Hopefully Riot does something about the entire system sooner rather than later (fingers crossed for this years preseason).

No, worst mistake you could make. Keep hoarding your IP until lvl 30, but you still wont have enough to build a proper specialized page for the role you play the most(so you could at least have runes for your main champions), so I suggest purchasing an IP boost. If that's out of the question, then just grind untill you have enough IP to comfortably build a generic rune page that will fit the role you enjoy the most across all its corresponding champions.
Oh no, I bought tier 1 runes. Now I can't buy that 1 armor seal I've been saving up for months to buy. Woe is me!
you can easily buy 1 generic ad and one generic ap runepage with tier 1 runes, they are pretty cost-efficient. Just stay away from Tier 2 runes, they are a trap!
just get tier 3 runes. tier one and two suck

Ide recommend waiting until 30 to buy the tier 1 runes. What I would start doing asap however, is start building up IP so when you hit 30 you'll have around 20k worth of IP to build some worthwhile pages.

I would also start getting really really good at a handful of champs that would work well with a standard AP/AD rune page.
Go for it at level 20, the only runes that matter are T3

I got the same advice when I was leveling up from people, they said dont get tier 1 or 2 runes theyre a waste of IP

Kinda feel like those people are total idiots though, considering how insanely cheap t1 and 2 runes are and what a difference they'd have made when I was trying to learn how to jungle etc. 

For basically the price of nothing at all you can get tier 1 runes in every slot and theyre about 50% effective compared to t3. they're actually a great bargain that help you not be at such a disadvantage compared to higher level players

Never buy tier 1-2 runes.
Ever.
They're just so ew and its best to just level up and then spend your RP on champs and tier 3 runes.
